page.title: 12DINGLE FARM LIVESTOCK
page.content: The breed of{cattle}kept are{North {Devon}(Ruby Reds).There are{60 cows and{5 bulls.}The calves are bred on the farm and some of these are kept. The cattle are kept in large sheds in the winter and at grass in the summer. Their{winter feed}is potatoes or fodder beet, barley and straw, with silage, barley, hay or straw for the calves. The farm has{300 ewes}which breed{500 {lambs.}The lambs are born inside. They are fattened and sold. Their{feed}is grass plus sugar beet tops, nuts, barley and hay. There are{100}sows which produce{20 {piglets}each per year.The pigs are{fed pellets which are bought in. The cattle are shown at agricultural shows and win prizes. In{1981}they won the{Champion Bull}in Country award.
